aas:langStringTextType.aas:text: This aspect represents the estimated and actual delivery information of one specific item, which is being shipped from the supplier to the customer.

The positions refer to positions within an order of the given item (see material number supplier, material number customer and material global asset ID) for which the delivery information is exchanged. The positions can be differentiated by the order position reference. If no order position reference is given, then there is only one position containing all estimated deliveries of the item.

The Position can contain one or more deliveries involving one or more supplier's and one or more customer's sites. A position may be anonymous (no orderPositionReference is set) or may reference a position within an order.
Encapsulates the references to identify a position within an order.

aas:langStringNameType.aas:text: Estimated or actual delivery from supplier to a customer

aas:langStringTextType.aas:text: Deliveries are referred to the deliveries of an order position. One order position can be split into multiple deliveries. One delivery can have a different origin and destination than another delivery.
Quantity, origin and destination, time of departure and arrival, tracking number and incoterms for a certain delivery.
Entity for common measurements of an item (mass, count, linear, area, volume, misc) with an unit and a value.
Entity for specifying the departure or arrival time and date.

Transit locations describes the specific location where products undergo the process of being transported from the source or production facility (origin) to the designated endpoint location (destination).

Location refers to a specific place that can be identified with two parameters - business partner number site (BPNS) and business partner number address (BPNA). Location MUST include BPNS and it MAY include BPNA.

Location refers to a specific place that can be identified with two parameters - business partner number site (BPNS) and business partner number address (BPNA). Location MUST include BPNS and it MAY include BPNA.

aas:langStringNameType.aas:text: UUID of the Part Type Twin

aas:langStringTextType.aas:text: This aspect represents the estimated and actual delivery information of one specific item, which is being shipped from the supplier to the customer.

aas:langStringDefinitionTypeIec61360.aas:text: This aspect represents the estimated and actual delivery information of one specific item, which is being shipped from the supplier to the customer.
This is the order number on the supplier side that is given by e.g., the supplier's enterprise resource planning system.
This is the order number on the customer side that can be given by e.g., the customer's enterprise resource planning system.

This is an identifier for the position of an order defined by the customer. It's not a technical identifier, such as an UUID. This identifier is used within the business context when talking about the position.
The order position reference contains information to identify a position within an order.
The quantity value associated with the unit.
The unit of an item. Common units may be related to mass, count, linear, area, volume or misc.
Amount of items of a delivery between a supplier and a customer.
Date and time at which the delivery has been updated by the data provider. Date and time are set according to the timezone.

Time of Event signifies the time and date when the products leave (or will leave) the origin location of a delivery (i.e. supplier's production site) or when the products arrive (or will arrive) at the destination location of the delivery (i.e. customer's production site).
Event type describes whether the mentioned timeOfEvent refers to a departure or arrival and provides the status of the delivery (estimated or actual).
Transit dates provide date and time of departure and date and time of arrival for a specific delivery. Date and time are set according to the timezone.
Property based on a BPNA.
Property based on a BPNS.
Origin refers to the starting point or the location from which the items are being shipped to the customer.
Property based on a BPNA.
Property based on a BPNS.
Destination refers to the final endpoint or intended location where the items are meant to arrive (i.e. customer factory).
Physical locations of the origin and destination.
Is a unique alphanumeric code assigned to a shipment by a logistics service provider, allowing it to be monitored and traced throughout its journey between origin and destination.
Incoterm which is assigned to a delivery.

aas:langStringNameType.aas:text: Estimated or actual delivery from supplier to a customer

aas:langStringPreferredNameTypeIec61360.aas:text: Estimated or actual delivery from supplier to a customer

aas:langStringDefinitionTypeIec61360.aas:text: Deliveries are referred to the deliveries of an order position. One order position can be split into multiple deliveries. One delivery can have a different origin and destination than another delivery.

The positions refer to positions within an order of the given item (see material number supplier, material number customer and material global asset ID) for which the delivery information is exchanged. The positions can be differentiated by the order position reference. If no order position reference is given, then there is only one position containing all estimated deliveries of the item.

aas:langStringNameType.aas:text: UUID of the Part Type Twin

aas:langStringPreferredNameTypeIec61360.aas:text: UUID of the Part Type Twin

aas:langStringDefinitionTypeIec61360.aas:text: Identifier used uniquely to identify part type twin.
